system.description:
Those who practice the tried and true seven liberal arts at the universities are also known to learn sciences more occult, and they are as often taken for

the Devil’s fellows as they are courted by counts and buÌˆrgermeisters. Due to Helv.czia’s liberties, Students are widespread there: in forest retreats, the  fastnesses of the higher valleys, and even in towns, they ply their trade openly. Although it is well known that Students’ lust for a fight is not inconsiderable after a few cups, and a few of them turn the blade as well as their tongue, they are no match for the real Fighter, and cannot wear heavy armour.

  • Attack bonus: Level*2/3
  • Saving throws: Temptation by the first, Bravery and Deftness by the second column
  • Weapon use: any
  • Armour use: light only
  • Hp: 1d6 per level

As the spells of Students are ab ovo against the will of the Mother Church, their magical practices have the following limitations:

  • Students in a state of high Virtue cannot memorise new spells until they achieve an average or lower rating with a few choice sins.
  • At particularly holy places – e.g. the resting place of a saint or the den of a particularly pious hermit – Student spells only work after a successful temptation check.
